article_title: Why Extending Enrollment Deadlines Can Increase Premiums

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: One of the many factors that can cause a health insurance system to fail is “adverse selection,” a phenomenon in which those who know they will make higher-than-average claims are disproportionately likely to enroll and pay premiums.
og.title: Why Extending Enrollment Deadlines Can Increase Premiums
